body.p:
To his Excellency Beriah Magoffin
Governor of the State of Kentucky
Your petitioners would represent that at the February term of Bracken Circuit Court W. D Ratcliffe was fined the sum of two hundred dollars ^each^ in two cases for permitting gameing on his premises

They state that the offence was from the proof a verry small one, in the first case, the playing was done by some young men who were guarding a lunatic and during the night they engaged in a game of cards at five cents a game in order to keep awake, and in the second case some workmen in his employ played for enough money to buy a watermellon And the petitioners think that the cost and fees of the Commonwealths attorney is ample punishment for so small an offence
Wherefore they ask you to remit the ballance of the fines
